description: A short lesson to help you apply How Misinformation Spreads Online.

hook.text: MIT found that false news spreads six times faster than true news on Twitter.

buildup.text: Vosoughi, Roy, and Aral analyzed 126,000 stories spread by 3 million people.

twist.text: Bots helped, but humans were the main spreaders. We don't need AI to spread lies â€” our psychology does it naturally.

climax.text: Algorithms amplify what gets engagement. Misinformation gets more engagement. The system rewards falsehood by design.

punchline.text: Lies spread fast because they feel important. Truth is often boring.
